dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, there's this new company, Nikola, making a huge splash on Wall Street. Like, a really audacious debut for a high-tech transportation startup, uh, since Tesla, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, there's this new company, Nikola, making a huge splash on Wall Street. Like, a really audacious debut for a high-tech transportation startup, uh, since Tesla, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With plans to shake up commercial trucking with zero-emission vehicles and fuel, its the most audacious Wall Street debut for a high-tech transportation startup since Teslas a decade ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the one everyone's calling the next Tesla, right? [overlaps] Um, with their ticker NKLA?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the one everyone's calling the next Tesla, right? Um, with their ticker N K L A?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of the combined new company start trading Thursday with the ticker NKLA.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And their founder, Trevor Milton, he's just full steam ahead. Says they're "kicking ass."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And their founder, Trevor Milton, he's just full steam ahead. Says they're kicking ass.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We're full steam ahead, says Nikola founder Trevor Milton, whos giving up his CEO role with the merger to become executive chairman. ... We're kicking ass.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Kicking ass," huh? Sounds like Elon Musk. So, what are they actually making, like, electric trucks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kicking ass, huh? Sounds like Elon Musk. So, what are they actually making, like, electric trucks?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's a mix. They're starting production of electric trucks, the Tre, in Europe next year. But then also hydrogen fuel cell models in the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's a mix. They're starting production of electric trucks, the Tre, in Europe next year. But then also hydrogen fuel cell models in the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Production of electric Nikola Tre trucks starts in Europe in 2021 with partner CNH/Iveco, with some units to be exported to the U.S., ahead of the opening of Nikolas U.S. factory that will build both battery and hydrogen fuel cell models.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hydrogen? [overlaps] I mean, that sounds... complicated. And expensive, uh, traditionally?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hydrogen? I mean, that sounds... complicated. And expensive, uh, traditionally?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it used to be. But the article says the technology has really matured. Costs for materials, fuel tanks, they've all dropped dramatically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it used to be. But the article says the technology has really matured. Costs for materials, fuel tanks, they've all dropped dramatically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats changed dramatically in the past decade, with costs for the materials and fuel tanks dropping steadily as the technology matured.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. But this big vision, it's gonna need a lot of cash, right? I heard they need, like, another $700 million in equity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. But this big vision, it's gonna need a lot of cash, right? I heard they need, like, another seven hundred million dollars in equity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company estimates it will need to raise an additional $700 million of equity financing between late 2021 and early 2022, according to an SEC filing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. Plus half a billion in debt, and almost a billion for those hydrogen stations. It's a huge undertaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. Plus half a billion in debt, and almost a billion for those hydrogen stations. It's a huge undertaking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additionally, it will probably issue debt in 2023 and 2024 totaling $500 million. Spending on hydrogen stations, which will make the clean fuel from water and renewable electricity, will run to nearly $1 billion from 2022 through 2024, according to the filing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Still, they've already got ten billion dollars in orders from companies like Anheuser-Busch. That's, um, pretty impressive for a company that hasn't delivered a truck yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, they've already got ten billion dollars in orders from companies like Anheuser-Busch. That's, um, pretty impressive for a company that hasn't delivered a truck yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nikola has secured truck orders worth $10 billion from companies led by Anheuser-Busch, which wants 800 of the companys non-polluting behemoths. ... While the company has yet to deliver trucks to commercial customers, theres been a steady uptick in interest in hydrogen for heavy-duty trucks

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, that's the thing, isn't it? No actual revenue to speak of yet, but big projections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the thing, isn't it? No actual revenue to speak of yet, but big projections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, Nikola hasnt generated much revenue but estimates sales will jump from $150 million in 2021 to $3.2 billion by 2024 as it ramps up productions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: True, true. But the interest in hydrogen for long-haul is really picking up. Lighter than batteries, faster refueling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, true. But the interest in hydrogen for long-haul is really picking up. Lighter than batteries, faster refueling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: theres been a steady uptick in interest in hydrogen for heavy-duty trucks, particularly long-haul vehicles, as fuel cell power systems are much lighter than batteries and can be refueled about as fast as diesel and gasoline models.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Milton, he's convinced Nikola's the one who "disrupted the entire industry" and made hydrogen the hottest topic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Milton, he's convinced Nikola's the one who disrupted the entire industry and made hydrogen the hottest topic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What I love about Nikola is we've shown how to disrupt the entire industry. At every (truck) group in the world now hydrogen is the hottest topic. And guess who did that? says Milton, who like Musk, isnt shy about boasting what his company can do. It was majority caused by Nikola

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, uh, we'll see if they can actually deliver on those promises. It's definitely one to watch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, uh, we'll see if they can actually deliver on those promises. It's definitely one to watch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. A lot riding on this one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. A lot riding on this one.
